That was 916 more of the handsome raptors than were seen in the same 42 states last year, and continued the national symbol's slow but steady increase since the eagle surveys were organized five years ago.

title: A.C.L.U. REVIEWS SUPPORT OF INFORMATION BILL
description: The American Civil Liberties Union is reviewing its support for legislation that would exempt most of the operational files of the Central Intelligence Agency from requests under the Freedom of Information Act.

title: 'Substantial Hunger' Is Cited in Southwest
description: The Southwest has a ''substantial hunger and malnutrition'' problem, a team of physicians traveling the country to investigate hunger in America says.

title: Marion Talmage Weds Georges Boyer
description: Marion Prentice Talmage, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Prentice Talmage Jr. of Far Hills, N.J., and Georges Carter Boyer, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Georges Maurice Boyer of Vail, Colo., were married yesterday. Canon John T. Morrow performed the ceremony at St. Luke's Episcopal Church in Gladstone, N.J.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: Few people who had the opportunity of seeing the International Games for the Disabled would disagree with Odeda Rosenthal's observations on the courage and excitement generated by the 1,800 athletes in the competition. She is erroneous in her assumption, however, that the event was largely ignored by the media but for a few ''stringers.''

title: THE CAREFUL SHOPPER
description: Parking Lot Sale By A. I. Friedman A. I. Friedman in the Caldor Shopping Plaza in Port Chester is planning a one-day-only parking lot sale next Sunday of its discounted artist and craft supplies, discontinued items at up to 80 percent markdowns and special-purchase manufacturers' ends in easels, flat files, drafting furniture, brushes, paper, doll-house miniatures, yarns and latchhooking kits, among other items. The rain date (or what the manager called the ''monsoon date'') is Sept. 23 and the hours are 9 A.M. to 3 P.M.

title: NORWALK REDISCOVERS A TROVE OF MURALS
description: IN Norwalk, 16 large oil paintings were locked up in August

title: CONSIDER OPTIONS WITH CARE
description: ANYONE buying a single-family house or a condominium before it is completed can usually choose from a list of extras that the builder or developer is willing to provide at additional cost. These may include central air-conditioning, a fireplace in the master bedroom or an upgrading to a better quality carpeting or a more expensive refrigerator or range.

title:
ART;
GLIMPSES OF THE BRITISH EMPIRE IN PHOTOGRAPHS
description: PHOTOGRAPHERS in the British Empire during the Victorian era were able to scour the globe for rare and exotic subjects. That is the basis of ''More Vivid Places,'' at the Davison Art Center at Wesleyan University in Middletown through Oct. 25.

title: WHO IS TO DEFINE GIFTED?
description: LEGISLATION currently before the Assembly and Senate calls for categorical aid to support programs of education for the gifted. These bills (A. 623 and S. 637) are a welcome acknowledgement of the state's stake in developing gifts and talents, but there is substantial danger that narrow definitions of who is gifted may lead to programs that miss the most creatively gifted students in favor of those who are simply good at scoring high on tests.

title: Florida Ties L.S.U. at 21-21
description: Lorenzo Hampton ran 15 yards for a touchdown with 4 minutes 55 seconds to play and Bobby Raymond kicked the extra point to give Florida a 21-21 tie with Louisiana State in a Southeastern Conference game today.

title: Miss Bromley Is Bride Of Frank John DiGraci
description: K. Lynn Bromley, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David Allan Bromley of North Haven, Conn., was married yesterday to Frank John DiGraci, the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Luciano DiGraci of New York. The Rev. Gaylord B. Noyce performed the ceremony at Marquand Chapel at Yale University.

title: Suspension Protested A day after the Louisiana Boxing and Wrestling Commission announced that it had suspended the licenses of the fighter
description: Ray (Boom Boom) Mancini and his manager, Dave Wolf, for 60 days, Wolf complained that the action had been highly irregular and for a simple reason. ''We never had Louisiana licenses to begin with,'' he said, explaining that under the commission rules he had planned to submit applications for the licences at the weigh- in of yesterday's cancelled fight against Kenny Bogner in New Orleans.

title: Johnnie Parsons Dead at 66;Won Indianapolis 500 in '50
description: Johnnie Parsons, winner of the Indianapolis 500 auto race in 1950 and a former national driving champion, died of a heart attack today at his home in Van Nuys.

title: Barbara A. Blair, Stuart S. Randall Wed in Princeton
description: Barbara Anne Blair, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. David William Blair of Princeton, N.J., was married yesterday to Stuart Spalding Randall, a son of Mrs. James Hughes Cannon of Edgartown, Mass., and the late Donn Spalding Randall. The Rev. Patrick Boyle, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Princeton University Chapel.

title: French Banking
description: To The Editor:

title: IRANIAN JET IS HIJACKED TO EGYPT AND IRAQ
description: An Iran Air jetliner carrying more than 120 people was hijacked on a domestic flight Saturday and forced to land in Bahrain and then Cairo. After 52 people dashed to freedom there, the plane was flown to Iraq today, an airport security official here said.

title: AMID OBSTACLES, EDUCATORS AIMING TO IMPROVE SCHOOLS
description: As the new school year begins, educators around the country are turning to the task of carrying out one of the most widespread attempts to improve American public education in its history.

title: UNDER THE NEW RULES APARTHEID STILL WINS
description: South Africa's images last week - a kind of coronation and chaos - might have been drawn from different lands whose events converge only in conflict.

title: STANDING BY JEFFERSON
description: Having unwisely injected religion into the Presidential campaign, Ronald Reagan now protests fulsomely that he didn't mean to promote any one religion over another, or all others. No, indeed - the only religion Mr. Reagan has openly sought to promote is religion itself. But that's the trouble.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in the Arts and Leisure section Aug. 19 about the Cable News Network inaccurately described an incident at the Democratic National Convention in which former Gov. John B. Connally of Texas, acting as a CNN commentator, had been threatened by a crowd. The group was made up of Democrats.

title: 'OUTSIDER' HEADS CAMPAIGN By States News Service
description: WASHINGTON ALTHOUGH Senator Christopher Dodd, Democrat of Connecticut, backed Senator Gary Hart for the Presidential nomination, one of Mr. Dodd's key aides has been named to head the New Jersey campaign of Senator Walter Mondale and Representative Geraldine Ferraro.

title: 4 Killed in Connecticut In Crash of Helicopter
description: Four occupants of a small commercial helicopter were killed today when it struck utility wires here as the victims left a picnic, officials said.

title: Carol Roeder Is the Bride Of Ivar P. Buch, Geologist
description: The marriage of Carol Roeder and Ivar Philip Buch, graduates of the University of Vermont, took place Monday at the Roslyn (L.I.) Country Club. The Rev. Paul V. Cunkle, a retired Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.

title: RALLYING WOMEN ON NUCLEAR WAR ISSUES
description: Joanne Woodward has a new role. On Wednesday in Washington she will be the leading lady at the first National Women's Conference to Prevent Nuclear War.

title: THE GREAT WARS OVER SUPERCHIPS
description: Murray Goldman swears that for as long as he lives, he will always remember March 29, 1984, as a ''white-knuckle day.''

title: Laura Rogers Married To Colin Winans Myer
description: The Indian Harbor Yacht Club in Greenwich, Conn., was the setting yesterday for the wedding of Laura Marie Rogers, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert D. Rogers of Greenwich and Delray Beach, Fla., to Colin Winans Myer, a son of Mr. and Mrs. C. Randolph Myer 2d of Manchester, Mass. The Rev. J. Lawrence Dannemiller, a Congregational minister and uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony.

title: Games for the Disabled: Additional Views
description: My congratulations to Odeda Rosenthal for her remarkable article regarding the International Games for the Disabled (''Why the Snub? They, Too, Are Winners in Athletics,'' Opinion Page, Aug. 19).

title: 18 Food Outlets Cited by City For Violations of Health Code
description: The New York City Department of Health cited 18 food establishments last week for violating the health code.

title: THE REPUBLICANS
description: Richard Reeves is a syndicated columnist and the author of ''American Journey: Traveling with Tocqueville in Search of Democracy in America.''

title: WARRIOR LIBERALS
description: Walter Karp is the author of ''The Politics of War'' and the forthcoming ''The Empire and the Mob,'' a history of the Korean War. THE TORCH IS PASSED

title: DISABILITY REVIEWS SPUR LEGAL 'CRISIS'
description: The Social Security Administration has concluded in a new study that its efforts to remove people from the disability rolls have produced a ''major crisis in litigation'' and led to a ''huge volume of adverse court decisions.''

title: STUDENS OFFERED PREVIEWS
description: '' THE best salesperson is a satisfied customer,'' said Genevieve Ann Flaherty of Bronxville, the new dean of admissions at the State University of New York at Purchase. ''That's why I'm involving students in my plans to help prospective freshmen see the reality of the school.''

title: CONGRESS PONDERS DRUG EXPORT BILL
description: A debate is going on in Congress over whether American manufacturers ought to have the right to export drugs that have not been approved for use in the United States.

title: HELLO APARTMENTS
description: These days there are no boundaries on what sort of buildings can be recycled as living spaces.

title:
GARDENING;
THE SUBTLE ART OF READING PLANT LEAVES
description: Although the value of reading tea leaves to tell the future is dubious, reading plant leaves as a means of identifying their problems is not.

title: LANDMARK STATUS DIVIDES A CENTRAL PARK WEST CO-OP
description: WHEN a building goes co-op, the transition from tenant to shareholder is about as easy as carrying a piano across a swaying suspension bridge with an angry gorilla in hot pursuit.

title: MORE STATE POLICE URGED FOR JERSEY
description: An Assembly committee has urged the state police to assign 55 additional troopers to the New Jersey Turnpike and use two-man patrols at all times as a security precaution.

title: LETTERS ; Continental
description: To the Editor:

title:
DANCE;
NEW PURCHASE DEAN OF DANCE
description: ''I HAVE had a wonderful time as a performer, and I'm still an incurable ham - but I find great satisfaction in this end of the work,'' said Carol K. Walker, the new dean of dance at the State University of New York at Purchase, speaking about her role as administrator. ''I love watching the students work and seeing their progress. It's terribly satisfying and very exciting to be able to help facilitate that.''

title: Rayburn Never Retired
description: To the Editor:

title: International
description: SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 9, 1984 Nicaraguan rebels raised $10 million in the last six months from corporations and individuals in the United States and from foreign governments, according to Reagan Administration officials and rebel leaders. The countries that reportedly contributed include Israel, Argentina, Venezuela, Guatemala and Taiwan. Each of the foreign governments had denied any involvement with the rebels. (Page 1, Column 6.) Plans to build homes in Nicaragua for landless peasants were announced by former President Jimmy Carter, a director of Habitat for Humanity, a nonprofit, international Christian organization that builds housing for the poor. Mr. Carter and other members of the Habitat group spent a week in New York beginning the renovation of a Lower East Side tenement. (13:1.)

title: William J. Whelan 3d Marries Susan H. Marren
description: Susan Helen Marren and William James Whelan 3d were married yesterday at the Fordham University Church in the Bronx. The Rev. Eugene J. O'Brien performed the Roman Catholic ceremony and concelebrated the nuptial mass with Msgr.

title: CONSUMER RATES
BRAZIL TESTS LIMITS OF LIBERATION THEOLOGY
description: Leonardo Boff, the Brazilian theologian who last week underwent four hours of interrogation by the Vatican for his advocacy of liberation theology, contends that he is not the real target. ''There's an old German adage,'' he said before his trip to Rome. ''You hit the yoke, but you think of the donkey. They're hitting me, but they're thinking of the church in Brazil.''

title: PAPERBACK BEST SELLERS Sept. 9, 1984
description: Fiction1 AUGUST, by Judith Rossner. (Warner, $4.50.) The five-year relationship of two women, a teen-age patient and her analyst. 2 THE WICKED DAY, by Mary Stewart. (Fawcett Crest, $4.50.) King Arthur, fulfilling a prophecy of Merlin, falls into an incestuous relationship. 3

title: PROSPECTS
description: Pay Now or Buy Later

title: HOLDING PENALTIES TROUBLE MCELROY
description: Reggie McElroy resolved today that he would not let get to him what had haunted and hounded the career of his predecessor, Chris Ward.

title: Susan J. von Hoffman Is Wed in Jersey
description: Susan Jeffries von Hoffman, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Ferdinand von Hoffman of Upper Montclair, N.J., was married at St. James' Episcopal Church there yesterday to Steven Moury Tompson, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Schuyler W. Tompson of Albuquerque, N.M. The Rev. Christine Tremaine of St. James' and the Rev. Dr. Robert D. Simpson, a United Methodist minister, performed the ceremony.

title: MILITARY LEADERS IN BRAZIL FUROR
description: Two of Brazil's top military leaders have touched off a political storm by publicly criticizing supporters of the opposition candidate in next year's presidential elections.

title: LETTERS TO THE EDITOR
description: I read Konrad Kellen's article with great interest, and I congratulate the ''new Germans'' on their desire not to accept military aggression as the solution to disputes. Whether this realization comes from demilitarization, experience or a real desire as a nation to find mature ways to solve political disputes, it is a welcome effort. BRIAN H. GARY Yonkers, N.Y.

title: Kristin Rambusch Wed to Alexander von Thelen
description: Kristin Grace Rambusch, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Viggo Bech Ansgar Rambusch of New York, was married yesterday to Alexander Carnaby von Thelen, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander J. von Thelen of Charlottesville, Va. Msgr. James G. Wilders performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at the St. Elizabeth Ann Seton Shrine in Manhattan.

title: SALVADORAN VILLAGERS REPORT ARMY MASSACRE
description: Something ugly, ''algo feo,'' happened in the rough mountain valleys surrounding this small village, according to local peasants.

title: IS A GENERATIONAL SEA CHANGE IN THE OFFING?
description: If we imagine photography to be an organism with feelings like the rest of us, then it enters the fall entertaining a complex set of emotions. There is a sense of optimism and empowerment as a result of the J. Paul

title: RAGTOPS ARE THE RAGE ONCE AGAIN
description: IT might be called the Gospel according to Chairman Lee. It says that automobiles ought to be fun, and one of Mr. Iacocca's early efforts in that direction spawned the Ford Mustang and the whole raft of pony-car imitators that followed.

title: PRIMARY ELECTION SET FOR TUESDAYZ
description: MILES RAPOPORT of West Hartford is used to running citizens groups. He has worked in them for 13 years, the last five as executive director of the Connecticut Citizen Action Group, lobbying for, among other things, a state income tax.

title: VERMONT CANDIDATES WAGE EXPENSIVE BATTLE
description: Two Republicans fighting for a chance at trying to succeed Gov. Richard A. Snelling have turned this year's gubernatorial contest into the most expensive ever in Vermont.

title: F.A.A. MIGHT BEND ON NEWARK PLAN
description: An official of the Federal Aviation Administration said today that the agency was agreeable to increasing the number of arrivals and departures from the Newark International Airport beyond the limits proposed earlier this week.

title: FOLLOW-UP ON THE NEWS ; Battle of Lotions
description: Many skin lotions are good, but only one can be best. Chesebrough- Pond's Inc. and the Procter & Gamble Company went to court over this issue in January, because their advertising was clearly at odds.

title: Tourist Help
description: To the Editor:

title: OFFICERS REASSIGNED IN COAST POLICE SCANDAL
description: Ten of the city's 21 police captains have been reassigned to new divisions in the wake of separate scandals involving a prostitute and a drug raid in a bar.

title: AT 92D ST. Y, AN EDUCATOR TAKES CHARGE
description: Dr. Robert M. Fisher has been a criminologist, a professional road-racing driver, a practicing lawyer, the Mayor of Lafayette, Calif., and the president of John F. Kennedy University, an innovative school in Orinda, Calif.

title: MUSIC SCHOOL DISCORD
description: A DISCORDANT note has been struck in an attempt by the Stecher and Horowitz School of the Arts in Cedarhurst to expand its facilities to include a 140-seat recital hall on a residential street.

title: Sudden Death
description: Michael Stott, 16 years old, was watching television at his girlfriend's house in Canandaigua, N.Y., on July 25 when he experienced a sudden seizure and collapsed. He was pronounced dead at 11:55 P.M.

title: WORKER HURT AS CRANE TOPPLES NEAR CARNEGIE HALL
description: A construction crane collapsed with a roar yesterday afternoon on the site of a planned 78-story tower near Carnegie Hall, trapping and seriously injuring the crane operator.

title: LETTERS TO THE EDITOR
description: The New Germans

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. 'INTEREST' THREATENED IN BEIRUT PHONE CALL
description: by JOHN KIFNER

title: Nutritionist Bill Called Discriminatory
description: The article about a bill to license nutritionists (Aug. 19) did not adequately emphasize a problem specific to such a bill: A whole range of professionals exist who are more specialized and better educated than dietitians in solving nutrition problems.

title: HARD-HAT TOURS
description: For years, the Municipal Art Society, through its walking tours, has been showing New Yorkers the city's landmarks, architecturally significant structures and historic districts in an effort to increase their awareness of and interest in protecting these treasures. On Tuesday the nonprofit organization will expand the scope of these municipal excurisons as it begins the first of its Hard Hat Tours designed to offer the tour participant a closer look at current construction and restoration projects.

title: POPE STARTS A TOUR OF CANADA TODAY
description: When Pope John Paul II arrives here Sunday for a 12- day tour of Canada, he will find a French Canadian population still 87 percent Catholic, but the role of the church vastly diminished.

title: BUYING CRAFTS UNDER THE TREES OF BARCELOS
description: The extreme north of Portugal has been touched by history but not much by tourists. Visitors will find its beaches beautiful and comparatively deserted and the cost of a stay modest. Most of all, a trip north provides a chance to visit the small, attractive 13th-century town of Barcelos and its vast outdoor market.

title: Peter Kern Weds Melinda Joy Peter
description: Melinda Joy Peter, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph George Peter of Lloyd Harbor, L.I., was married yesterday to Peter Harold Kern, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph F. Kern of Garden City and Westhampton Beach, L.I. The Rev. John Alexander performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception in Westhampton Beach and concelebrated the nuptial mass with Msgr. John Barry.

title: BUSINESS NOTES
description: THE Harborside Financial Center, a $400 million renovation of three warehouses and two piers in what is expected to become the nucleus of a new financial district on the Jersey City waterfront, is attracting tenants.

title: THE MENU IS DIVERSE AND THE FLAVOR IS TRULY INTERNATIONAL
description: There is an impressive diversity in this season's exhibition schedule that reflects the openness, internationalism and sense of possibility of the current art scene. It would be hard to imagine a season with more promising shows, on more kinds of art, from more corners of the world. In terms of 19th- and 20th-century painting, for example, there are major exhibitions on household names like Vincent van Gogh and Henri Rousseau, retrospectives on established artists whose stature is still being debated, such as Robert Motherwell, and ground-breaking retrospectives on the late Abstract Expressionist painter Lee Krasner and on Leon Golub, whose large-scale statements about political violence have helped make political art a serious issue.

title: RESEARCH FOCUSES ON BRAIN
description: FOUR New Jersey pharmaceutical companies are collaborating with physicians and scientists around the world to crack the mystery of schizophrenia and learn how to treat it.

title: NORWAY'S CIVILIZED MOUNTAIN TRAILS
description: What Norway may lack in delights of the flesh is more than balanced by its wealth of vigorous pleasures. In this land of stereotypically hearty Norse men and women, city blocks are crowded with outdoor equipment stores instead of cafes, and ''mountain walking,'' as the modest Norwegians call it (most Americans would call it good, strenuous hiking) is perhaps the national passion.

title:
ANTIQUES ;
IN WETHERSFIELD, THE PAST COMES ALIVE
description: WHAT more appropriate site for an antiques show than the oldest village in Connecticut?

title: HOUSTON TRIES TO REIN IN ITS SPRAWL
description: Suddenly the rural water towers and grain elevators disappear and a city rises on the steamy horizon. Everywhere there are dazzling silver, emerald and black towers, ''things that look like they were put up on a planet that would just bear life,'' as the British actor Jonathan Miller observed on a recent visit.

title: JERSEY ADDS NEW METHOD TO LICENSE TEACHERS
description: The New Jersey State Board of Education has created an alternative route to the classroom for qualified college graduates who want to become teachers but have not taken traditional education courses.

title: SEASON TO HIGHLIGHT EGGS
description: EGGS make the most quickly prepared lunch or supper dish at very little cost. They come into their element at the end of summer, when there is an abundance of all those things that go with them best: fresh tarragon, basil, chive, tomatoes, peppers, sweet corn - and even fresh zucchini blossoms.

title: CODGER WITH A CAMERA
description: Fran Schumer is a freelance writer and critic. SLOW FADE

title: THE WORLDS OF AUDIO AND VIDEO ARE NOW COMING TOGETHER
description: Video and audio have been rubbing elbows for some time, and last year, with the advent of hi-fi video cassette recorders, relations between the two were getting very close. Equipment now arriving in the stores leaves little doubt that a marriage of sorts has finally been consummated. At any rate, several new components are neither video nor audio in the traditional sense, but a hybrid of the two. They are intended for viewers and listeners who like to combine their video and audio equipment into a single media center. Such devices herald an imminent era in which the customary division between audio and video will vanish.

title: ONE-ARTIST SHOW AT NEW GALLERY
description: MORRISTOWN THE Lee Sclar Gallery, which opened here over the summer, has established an authoritative showcase for contemporary crafts in Morris County.

title: A TARNISHED 'NEW REALISM' FOR LABOR
description: Anyone who wants the slogan ''new realism'' is welcome to it. Britain's trade union movement used it to describe the strategy it adopted in the face of adversity at the annual meeting a year ago of the Trades Union Congress. By almost any measure, from unemployment to union rights, things got worse.

title: Nuptials in Seattle for Page Knudsen And John Cowles 3d, a TV Executive
description: Elizabeth Page Knudsen, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. C. Calvert Knudsen of Seattle, was married there yesterday to John Cowles 3d, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Cowles Jr. of Minneapolis. The Rev. Cabell Tennis performed the ceremony at St. Mark's Episcopal Cathedral.

title: A VILLAGE IN INDIA: RELUCTANT PROGRESS
description: James Traub is the author of the book ''India: The Challenge of Change.'' By James Traub How,'' I asked Mihil Lal Shukla one fine morning, ''has the village of Chirora changed since your boyhood?'' I had had trouble finding anyone to answer this question, but Shukla was the village priest, a venerable Brahmin whose round, wire-rimmed glasses lent him an air of sagacity. Shukla rocked on the balls of his feet, scratched his skinny chin and lapsed into silence. He couldn't think of anything either.

title: THE ENVIRONMENT
description: THE Linden plant of the General Motors Corporation has been given a one-year grace period by the Federal Environmental Protection Agency to comply with water-pollution standards that took effect June 30.

title: CONTENDERS IN PRIMARIES IN THE STATE TOMORROW
description: Following are the contested races in tomorrow's primary elections in New York State. Incumbent candidates are marked with an asterisk.

title: A BABY-SIZE TEAM IS CREATED FOR A GIANT'S TASK
description: Jamaica's main effort against the drug business consists of a 30-member narcotics squad that operates from a warehouse on the outskirts of Kingston, the capital.

title: O'CONNOR INTERVIEW EXCERPTS
description: Following are excerpts from remarks by Archbishop John J. O'Connor of New York in answer to a question about the Democratic Vice-Presidential candidate, Geraldine A. Ferraro, at a press conference Saturday in Altoona, Pa., as recorded by The New York Times through the facilities of the radio station WFGB.

title: BALDWIN UNIT'S SALE IS BACKED
description: A court-appointed panel has approved a plan to sell the Mortgage Guaranty Insurance Corporation to the Northwestern Mutual Life Insurance Company and an MGIC management group, the panel's chairman has announced.

title: Lebanese Aide Warns Israel of Suicide Raids
description: The leader of Lebanon's Shiite Moslems, who is also a leading figure in the national coalition Cabinet, said today that young Lebanese were trained and ready for suicide attacks against Israeli forces in southern Lebanon.

title: People
description: * Lawrence N. Green promoted to executive vice president, director of marketing services, at Arnold & Company, Boston.

title: Pop: A Comic Leads Revue From India
description: In India, as elsewhere, one route

title: Ferraro Campaign Poster Echoes French Painting
description: Taking off on a famous French painting, Montana Democrats have unveiled a campaign poster featuring Vice Presidential candidate Geraldine A. Ferraro as ''Liberty Leading the People.''

title: HIJACKERS OF IRANIAN PLANE GET ASYLUM IN IRAQ
description: Hijackers who commandeered an Iranian airliner Saturday freed the plane and 66 hostages today in return for political asylum in Iraq.

title: Papua New Guinea Volcano
description: Villagers around the Mount Ulawun volcano on New Britain Island were evacuated today as the volcano began to spew ash and lava. Government officials said scientists had reported a steady buildup of seismic activity and predicted an eruption within days.

title: Botswana's President Is Returned to Power
description: President Quett K. Masire's ruling Botswana Democratic Party was returned to power in elections Saturday, but the party dropped at least two seats to the opposition, according to results announced today.

title: THE REGION ; Nurses Ratify Pact To End L.I. Strike
description: Striking nurses at Southampton Hospital today ratified a new two- year contract that includes salary increases of 6.5 percent each year, according to a union spokesman.

title: Extra Guards on Duty After Prison Incident
description: Prison officials transferred 35 prisoners and put 40 extra guards on duty today at the Brunswick Correction Center, where rebellious inmates held a guard and other prisoners hostage Saturday.

title: No Headline
description: Jacksons Going to Canada

title: Abigail A. Jones, A Lawyer, Weds
description: Abigail Ainsworth Jones, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Cranston Jones of New York, was married in Manhattan yesterday to Jeffrey Mark Mandell, a son of Edward Mandell of Riverdale, the Bronx, and Stockbridge, Mass., and Beverly Mandell of East Meadow, L.I. The Rev. James Nicholls, an Episcopal priest, and Rabbi Burton Siegel performed the ceremony at Harkness House.

title: ;  Waltrip Victor
description: Darrell Waltrip used a late pit stop to correct a tire problem, then captured the Wrangler 400 Nascar Grand National race at the Richmond Fairgrounds today. The triumph in the 216.8-mile race was his fifth of the season, tops among drivers on the Winston Cup circuit.

title: OVERTAXED BY TAX REVISION
description: However much they disagree about whether or not to raise taxes, Walter F. Mondale and Ronald Reagan agree that we need some sort of tax reform. In this, I believe, they both are wrong: The last thing the country needs now is another wholesale revision of the tax code.

description: Tax-Exempt Bonds*10.18

title: How to Grade the Schools The Chancellor of New York City's public schools, Nathan Quinones, proposes annual report cards to evaluate his system's performance. That's a promising idea. The Chancellor has named the subjects he would grade, among which parents and the public can find the issues of greatest concern.
description: Our report card would carefully grade the schools in the following categories:

title: MONDALE SEEKS 175-BILLION CUT IN 1989 DEFICIT
description: Walter F. Mondale plans to announce a plan Monday to reduce the Federal budget deficit by an estimated $175 billion in 1989, campaign aides said today.

title: SURGE FOR LUXURY BABY ITEMS
description: In a few weeks, Galway Irish Crystal will attempt to cash in on a new baby boom by selling its first infant- related item, a four-ounce, lead crystal baby bottle with a silverplated cap for about $38.50. The Boston-based distributor said there have been more than 5,000 requests for the bottle in the last two weeks.

title: No Headline
description: Bridge:At L.I. Final, a Rare Chance To Make 2 Calls at One Turn

title: Bus Lane to Holland Tunnel Opens Today on Hudson St.
description: A special lane outside the Holland Tunnel will be open to buses during the evening rush starting today to try to ease congestion at the Hudson River crossing, the Port Authority has announced.

title: ;  Burping the Lakes
description: Acid rain is no joking matter, nor for that matter is a bellyache. So James J. Bisogni Jr., a Cornell professor, is presumably serious in reporting a promising method to neutralize acid-contaminated lakes and ponds and make them safe again for fish.

title: No Headline
description: MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 10, 1984 International The U.S. was ready to discuss a joint moratorium on tests of new space weapons with the Soviet Union, Secretary of State George P. Shultz said, but he ruled out a Soviet proposal for a freeze of such tests in advance of actual negotiations. Previously, the Reagan Administration had said it was willing to engage in talks with Moscow on curbing the militarization of outer space so long as there were no conditions. The United States had not specifically addressed itself publicly to the moratorium question. (Page A1, Column 4.) Jamaica is a heavy contributor to the worsening American drug problem despite its position as one of the closest political allies of the United States. In the face of Congressional threats to cut off millions in economic aid, Jamaica has steadily been producing large amounts of marijuana for export to the United States. It is also increasingly being used as a base for transshipping cocaine from South America, United States officials say. (A1:2.)

title: FILIPINOS TO GET FOREIGN TYPHOON-RELIEF AID
description: The Government has moved to accept offers of emergency typhoon relief from the United States, Japan and members of the European Economic Community, the official press agency reported today.

title: Venezuelan Utility Rate
description: The president of Venezuela's largest private utility, La Electricidad de Caracas, has warned that unless the Government approves a major rate increase in the near future there will be ''no alternative'' to an eventual state takeover of the company.

title: Deborah S. Schindler Marries Todd Thaler
description: Deborah Susan Schindler, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joe P. Schindler of Great Neck, L.I., was married yesterday to Todd Michael Thaler, a son of Mrs. Stanley Reichman of Scarsdale, N.Y. Rabbis Harold Saperstein and David Saperstein performed the ceremony aboard the Peking, a four- masted bark at the South Street Seaport in Manhattan.

title: CHURCH IS AT CENTER OF LIFE FOR A FAMILY PROUD OF TRADITION
description: It was Nicole Anthony's day to be dipped in the water, to have her sins washed away and her spirit purified. It was her day to be baptized at the Upper Room Baptist Church.

description: THE chemical industry has been changing,

title: NO RIGHT-TO-LIFE NOMINATION
description: The Right to Life Party in New York has voted against nominating President Reagan or anyone else for President in the November election.

description: To the Editor:

title: Flying High
description: Normalization of relations between the United States and China will reach a new high later this month when a team of 18 Chinese experts participates for the first time in the history of their country in the world championship for model airplanes operated by control lines (as opposed to those operated by radio control).

title: Israeli Planes Attack Guerrillas in Lebanon
description: Israeli warplanes raided a Palestinian guerrilla base near the central Lebanese town of Bhamdoun overnight, an Israeli military spokesman said today.

title: EX-INTEL TEAM SET FOR SEQUENT DEBUT
description: Nearly 20 months ago, Casey Powell led a much-publicized exodus from the Intel Corporation, taking with him 16 of the computer company's executives and engineers. At the time, Mr. Powell, then Intel's manager of microprocessor operations, said that the group had no clear notion of what it would make.

title: 7 Reported Dead in India In Moslem-Hindu Strife
description: Moslem-Hindu clashes in Hyderabad were reported to have left at least 7 people dead and 130 wounded today. The authorities called out troops, imposed a 24-hour curfew on the southern city and ordered that rioters be shot on sight.

title: PAYTON STARS AS BEARS ROMP
description: Walter Payton ripped off a 72-yard touchdown run and rushed for 179 yards in 20 carries today, breaking Jim Brown's combined yardage record and leading the Chicago Bears to a 27-0 victory over the Denver Broncos.

title: 2 Horses Loose On Expressway
description: Two horses were loose on the Long Island Expressway for a short time early today after a horse trailer overturned, the police said.

description: As a D train crossed the bridge into

title: F.D.R.'S OLD PULLMAN IS BACK ON THE TRACKS
description: When lobbyists in this town ply their influence with lawmakers and private clients, it is often over lavish meals in swank restaurants. But not if the company they represent is the Norfolk Southern Corporation.

title: SANITATION ART SHOWINGS BRIGHTEN WORKERS' IMAGE
description: Edwin Sheridan held his tie with one hand and scrubbed vigorously with the other, erasing the taunting graffiti: ''Trash Hound,'' ''Garbage Man'' and ''Can Man.''

title: Leslie Joyce Koeppel Weds Mark Friedman, a Lawyer
description: The marriage of Leslie Joyce Koeppel, a daughter of M. Herbert Koeppel of Hewlett Bay Park, L.I., and the late Edna Koeppel, to Mark L. Friedman, a son of Irving Friedman of Harrison, N.Y., and the late Rose Friedman, took place yesterday at the Pierre. Rabbi Joel Y. Zion officiated.

description: Investors and economists are closely watching the negotiations between the General Motors Corporation and the United Auto Workers for clues to the direction of interest rates.

title: JOUSTING OVER THIN, HOT AIR
description: If the clamor in Congress and around the country this campaign year about the Federal budget deficit could be translated into action, there is no doubt the deficit would be on the decline.
