title: A CITRUS NURSERY BEGINS TO GOUP IN SMOKE
description: They started burning Sweet's Nursery today, eight acres of young orange and grapefruit trees that state and Federal officials say have been contaminated by a virulent disease that is threatening Florida's $2.5 billion citrus industry.

title: THE REGION ; ;  Death of Girl, 15, Ruled a Suicide
description: The shooting death of a 15-year-old honor student was ruled a suicide today, bringing the number of self-inflicted deaths of teen-agers in the three suburban counties north of New York to 11 this year.

title: POLICE BREAK UP MANILA PROTEST
description: More than 2,000 police and soldiers charged anti-Government demonstrators holding an all-night vigil outside President Ferdinand E. Marcos's presidential palace this morning.

title: SADDENED MAREE RETURNS TO RUNNING
description: Sydney Maree's last race was in his mind. It hurt almost as much as the muscle behind his left knee, especially since he could imagine looking over his shoulder while holding off Sebastian Coe in the final of the Olympic 1,500-meter run at Los Angeles.

title: DEVELOPING LANDS LOSE PLEA
description: The United States and other leading industrial countries, with the principal exception of France, today rejected demands from developing countries to make more money available to help resolve the debt crisis.

title: OPERA: ITALIAN DOUBLE BILL
description: There were new voices in Thursday night's Italian double bill at the New York City Opera, and among them were pleasures both predictable and unexpected.

title: DELAY CHARGED ON LIST OF TOXIC SITES
description: Representative James J. Florio today released a new list of potentially dangerous toxic waste sites prepared by the Environmental Protection Agency and charged that the agency had delayed issuing the list for ''blatantly political'' reasons.

title: INTERMOUNTAIN LABORATOIES reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
FAIR IN NEW ORLEANS GETS BREAK ON TAXES TO PAY ITS EXPENSES
description: Gov. Edwin W. Edwards said today that the debt-plagued world's fair here would be allowed to pay its daily expenses with money the city said was owed it as taxes, assuring that it would stay open until its scheduled closing in November.

title: OPERA: PITTSBURGH OFFERS A FIRST VERDI 'LEGNANO'
description: Considering the perennial popularity of Verdi's operas, it may seem strange to hear that any of them have gone unproduced in this country. But ''La Battaglia di Legnano'' received what was believed to be its first fully professional American stage performance Thursday night when the Pittsburgh Opera mounted this singularly interesting, though admittedly minor, product of the composer's middle years.

title: Niekro to Pitch in 1985 DETROIT, Sept. 21 - Phil Niekro, startled at the fuss made over a
description: report of his possible retirement, said today he had no plans to retire. ''I have a contract,'' the Yankees' 45-year-old pitcher said.

title: PATENTS ;
description: Method of Preventing Counterfeit Currency

title: Rates Up as Dollar Falls
description: Interest rates rose yesterday by a tenth of a percentage point or more for short- and long-term securities, as traders reacted to the sharp decline in the value of the dollar in foreign exchange markets.

title: No Headline
description: Foster Band Tonight

title: Banks Pleads Not Guilty
description: Dennis Banks, the Indian activist who fled South Dakota in 1975 after being found guilty of riot charges, pleaded not guilty today to a Federal count of flight to avoid confinement after conviction. Mr. Banks entered the plea in a brief appearance before the United States Magistrate, Thomas Parker. Mr. Banks, 47 years old, one of the founders of the American Indian Movement, asked for a jury trial.

title: Filing Deadline Voided In Jersey Election Law
description: A Federal district judge has declared unconstitutional a section of the state's election law setting a filing deadline for independent candidates for public office.

title: FERRARO STRIKES BACK AT OPPOSITION
description: Geraldine A. Ferraro came to Orange County, a stronghold of President Reagan, today and proposed that the President might like to do the same, a few years earlier than he had planned.

title: EDITORS' NOTE
description: Under this heading, The Times amplifies articles or rectifies what the editors consider significant lapses of fairness, balance or perspective.

title: Kingman Suspended
description: Dave Kingman, the Oakland A's slugger who is second in the major leagues in home runs (35) and runs batted in (117), may not be able to pick up any ground next week. Yesterday, he was given a three-game suspension by the American League president, Bobby Brown, for charging the mound and touching off a bench- clearing brawl after being hit by the Chicago White Sox pitcher Rich Dotson in a game Sept. 10. It was the 11th suspension Brown has imposed this season, his first as president. The suspension will begin Monday unless Kingman appeals before then.

title: UNITED STOCKYARDS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
LOW-KEY ELEGANCE BY GLORIA SACHS
description: On a crystalline morning when summer had not yet abdicated, Lord & Taylor sponsored a quiet, unprepossessing fashion show to benefit the Museum of the City of New York. Some 200 women paid $35 a ticket to have a cup of tea or coffee and an hors d'oeuvre or two, to view the showing of Gloria Sachs's clothes - and still have plenty of time to get to their lunch dates with ease.

title: No Headline
description: Parsons Approves Bid by Employees

title: C. MAXWELL STANLEY
description: C. Maxwell Stanley, whose international consulting concern and his efforts for global peace earned him a worldwide reputation, died Thursday in New York.

title: Much of South Texas Flooded by 5-Day Rain
description: Five consecutive days of rain left vast areas of southern Texas inundated today, forcing more than 90 people out of their homes and causing up to $50 million in damage, officials said.

title: 25 Sri Lanka Guerrillas Reported Killed by Navy
description: A Sri Lanka Navy patrol fired on three boats bringing Tamil rebels from southern India to Sri Lanka today, killing 25 guerrillas and destroying the boats, officials said.

title: RAX RESTAURANTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 30
DANCE: WORKSHOP OF 4 CHOREOGRAPHERS
description: What did you do last summer?'' Ask that question of Ellen Cornfield, Victoria Marks, Bill De Young and David Dorfman, and they might reply that they had choreographed the dances they offered Thursday night in the Theater of the Riverside Church.

title: ASTRONAUTS WILL SEEK TO RECOVER 2 STRAY SATELLITES
description: Astronauts aboard the space shuttle Discovery will try to recover two stranded satellites in November, a top official of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said today.

title: DOMINION RESOURCES INC(VA) (N) reports earnings for Year to Aug 30
Hershey to Buy Pillsbury Division
description: The Hershey Foods Corporation announced that it had reached an agreement with the Pillsbury Company for the purchase of the American Beauty Macaroni Company, a division of Pillsbury.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Business Day on Thursday about the Consolidated Rail Corporation incorrectly described a group seeking to buy the railroad.

title: Restarting of Nuclear Plant In Oregon Delayed by Failure
description: Utility officials delayed the restarting of the Trojan Nuclear Plant after two pumps and a generator failed in a test, a spokesman for the Portland General Electric Company said today.

title: No Headline
description: New Financing For Seabrook CONCORD, N.H., Sept. 21

title: GROWERS ASK MORATORIUM ON HARVEST TO CONTAIN CITRUS TANKER
description: The Florida Agriculture Commissioner came under intense pressure today to shut down the state's entire citrus industry for up to a month to minimize the risk that a virulent citrus canker will spread into groves and packing houses.

title: NEW COLUMBIA STADIUM: END OF A NOSTALGIC ERA
description: There were lines to buy football tickets at Columbia University this week.

title: New Forward
description: Reijo Ruotsalainen will be at left wing tomorrow night when the Rangers face the Islanders in an exhibition game at Madison Square Garden.

title: COURT UPHOLDS NIGHT BAN ON WNYC
description: A Federal appeals court, while acknowledging that ''residents of New York City will suffer a loss,'' today upheld a Federal order barring the city from continuing to operate its public AM radio station, WNYC, during night hours.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''Most times, when you lose a business, you lose it gradually.

title: FINANCIAL CORP. TO SELL C.D.'S ON WALL STREET
description: The troubled Financial Corporation of America plans to raise $1 billion in new deposits through Wall Street brokerage concerns, with Prudential- Bache Securities Inc. coordinating the sale, William J. Popejoy, Financial's new chairman, said today.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Weekend yesterday about record stores gave an incorrect telephone number for Dayton's at 824 Broadway. It is (212) 254-5084.

title: THE CORROBORATION REQUIREMENT IN PROSECUTING SEXUAL ABUSE
description: Last April, when Governor Cuomo signed a bill to permit convictions for child abuse to be based solely on the uncorroborated testimony of minors, the step was hailed by prosecutors and children's rights advocates. By requiring corroboration of what are characteristically clandestine acts, they argued, the old law habitually let even egregious offenders off the hook. But the new measure, which will permit judges and jurors to weigh the relative credibility of children and their purported victimizers, applies only to crimes committed on or after next Nov. 1. Thus, it will offer little assistance to District Attorney Mario Merola of the Bronx, whose office is investigating the largest series of sex abuse cases in New York City in recent years.

title: Bass Group Lifts Its Stake in Disney
description: A group led by the Bass Brothers of Texas yesterday said that it had increased its stake in Walt Disney Productions to 8.6 percent, from 5.5 percent.

title: SCREEN: BRONSON IN 'EVIL'
description: Whatever else Charles Bronson can do, audiences show up simply to watch him kill. The fact that ''The Evil That Men Do,'' Mr. Bronson's latest, nominally concerns itself with human-rights violations merely makes the violence all the juicier.

title: NAVRATILOVA BREAKS MARK WITH VICTORY
description: Martina Navratilova completed a rain-delayed 6-1, 6-2 thrashing of Melissa Brown today to stretch her winning streak to a record-breaking 56 matches.

title: MORGAN GUARANTY TRIMS PRIME RATE
description: E. Gerald Corrigan has been named president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. Page 39.

title: 2 ARE SHOT DURING AN ESCAPE ATTEMPT AT L.I. COURT
description: Two prisoners in Nassau County Court for a hearing on murder charges were foiled in an escape attempt this morning, but not before one of them and a court officer were wounded in an exchange of gunfire.

title: Shamrock Gets 10% Orion Stake
description: Shamrock Holdings Inc. said it had acquired 10 percent of the common shares of the Orion Capital Corporation, a property and casualty insurance company based in New York. A Shamrock spokesman said the stock was bought for ''investment purposes only.''

title: Upjohn Heir in Sex Case Is Sentenced Anew
description: Roger A. Gauntlett, an Upjohn Company heir originally sentenced to ''chemical castration'' and five years probation for raping his teen-age stepdaughter, was resentenced today to 5 to 15 years. The action came after a public outcry that the first penalty had been too lenient.

title: NEW H.R.A. CHIEF GIVES PRIORITY TO THE HOMELESS
description: The new Commissioner of the city's Human Resources Administration said yesterday that helping people with no place to live ''clearly has to be one of the first priorities.''

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY;
description: Softening a Tough Block

title: NEW QUARTERBACK TO FACE NEBRASKA
description: The preseason predictions in college football left the impression that U.C.L.A. and Nebraska were capable of being the No. 1 for this season. They will meet today in the Rose Bowl at Pasadena, Calif., and although they have 2-0 records, Nebraska has been more impressive.

title: Pessimism on Bank Bill
description: Representative Fernand J. St Germain, the chairman of the House Banking Committee, said today that it would be ''futile'' to try to push a banking deregulation bill through the House of Representatives this year.

title: Stan VanDerBeek Dies at 57; Made Experimental Movies
description: Stan VanDerBeek, a leading independent film maker, died of cancer Wednesday at Howard County General Hospital in Columbia, Md. He was 57 years old and lived in Baltimore.

title: COMPREHENSIVE CARE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
REAGAN AIDE HEADS PUBLIC BROADCASTING
description: A leading campaign organizer for President Reagan was elected today as chairman of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, which disburses Federal funds to public television and radio stations.

title: Late Selloff Hits Stocks; Dow Closes Down 14.80
description: Stock prices dropped yesterday in heavier trading, despite a cut in the prime rate by a major bank and the news that an agreement has been reached in the General Motors strike.

title: MINE WORKERS AND COAL OPERATORS REACH AGREEMENT ON PACT
description: Negotiators for the United Mine Workers and the Bituminous Coal Operators Association agreed today on a new, 40- month contract providing modest pay increases and new job security safeguards. The union said it provided for a 10 percent raise over the life of the contract.

title: GIANT ROOKIE CATCHES ON FAST
description: Bobby Johnson knew pro football would be tough.

title: CONSUMER PRICES UP BY 0.5%
description: The Consumer Price Index, the most widely watched inflation gauge, spurted five-tenths of 1 percent in August, more than twice the average gain of the preceding three months, the Labor Department said today.

title: FOODARAMA SUPERMARKETS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income including a pretax gain of $230,000 on the sale of assets.

title: TRUE COST OF BANK SERVICES
description: For many years, big commercial

title: Premiere for Play by Singer
description: The Jewish Repertory Theater will open its 11th season Oct. 13 with the premiere of the Isaac Bashevis Singer sex comedy ''Schlemiel the First.''

title: FRANCE AND ITALY AGREE TO EXTEND THEIR SEARCH FOR MINES IN RED SEA
description: A search for mines in the Red Sea was extended today after an explosion Thursday that damaged a Saudi ship and the recent discovery of devices believed to be mines.

title: India to Try 431 Sikhs Over Battle at Temple
description: A total of 431 Sikh extremists captured in a battle between separatist guerrillas and the Indian Army at the Golden Temple in Amritsar in June will go on trial next month, the Press Trust of India reported today.

title: THEY MAY HAVE KILLED TERRORIST SHORT OF GOAL- TOLL IS DISPUTED
description: The United States Embassy, which was devastated Thursday by a car bomb, appears to have been saved from total destruction and greater loss of life by the chance presence of bodyguards assigned to the British Ambassador.

title: CPS CHEMICAL CO reports earnings for Year to June 30
SATURDAY NEWS QUIZ
description: Questions are based on news reports in The Times this week. Answers appear on page 50.

title: 15 LEBANESEDRUSE HELD IN REVENGE KILLINGS
description: Fifteen Druse militiamen from the South Lebanon Army have been detained in the revenge killings of 13 residents of this Shiite Moslem village, an Israeli Army officer said today.

title: REPORT FAULTS U.S. EMBASSY SECURITY PLANS
description: A report by the investigative and auditing arm of Congress says a State Department program to increase security at American diplomatic posts abroad has been hampered by lack of direction, bureaucratic sluggishness, rising costs, financing limitations and ''disagreement over the details of security improvements.''

title: No Headline
description: Hepburn Book Relates Wartime Experiences

title: FDP CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
WICKES IS OUT OF CHAPTER 11
description: A Federal bankruptcy judge, declaring it ''a miracle,'' today approved a plan for the Wickes Companies to repay its creditors and emerge from two and a half years of a bankruptcy reorganization.

title: FIRST CITY PROPERTIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
description: b-Including tax credits of $300,000 for the quarter and $2.1 million for the 9 months. c-Including a tax credit of $1.2 million.

title: A TOWN FINDS IT DOESN'T PAY TO BE FRUGAL
description: Nobody claims that Columbia's school system does a bad job. It could pay its teachers more, of course, or buy more audio-visual equipment for the library. But it has never skimped on basics, its teaching staff is stable and its pupils do well in statewide achievement tests.

title: NEW YORK FED NAMES PRESIDENT
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York, the most influential outpost of the Federal Reserve System, yesterday named E. Gerald Corrigan as president, effective Jan. 1, replacing Anthony M. Solomon, who is leaving the bank at the mandatory retirement age of 65.

title: DOLLAR FALLS SHARPLY ON BONN MOVE
description: The foreign exchange markets were plunged into turmoil yesterday following concerted intervention by the Deutsche Bundesbank, the West German central bank. The move sent the dollar into a tailspin.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article Thursday on the rise in average scores on the Scholastic Aptitude Test across the country incorrectly reported the data for New York State. Average scores of this year's seniors in the state increased over last year's by two points on the verbal section, to 424 on a scale of 200 to 800, and by four points on the math section, to 470.

title: Core Repurchase
description: Core Industries said its board had authorized the repurchase of up to 500,000 shares of its common stock.

title: SYKES DATATRONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
BID TO SAVE JOBS AT G.M.
description: The tentative settlement between the United Automobile Workers and the General Motors Corporation is the first substantial effort in a major American manufacturing industry to confront the problem of job losses resulting from new technologies and the transfer of work to nonunion companies here or abroad.

title: HLH PETROLEUM CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
No Headline
description: Disney Workers to Vote On a Contract Monday
